headline.main: THE CENTRAL PARK.; Objections of Two of the Commissioners to the Plan Adopted.

docs.lead_paragraph: A CARD TO THE PUBLIC. The purchase of the land for the Central Park is believed to be the largest appropriation ever made by a single city for a public place to be devoted to health and pleasure, and is a striking evidence, not only of the wealth and liberality of the City, but of tje high .appreciation of the necessity which demanded its creation.

headline.main: XXXVth CONGRESS.......First Session.; SENATE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.snippet: The trouble in New-Orleans is not yet over, and it is to be feared that a great deal of blood is to be shed before quiet can be restored. Inflammatory placards against the Vigilance Committee were issued on Saturday evening, purporting to come from...
docs.lead_paragraph: The trouble in New-Orleans is not yet over, and it is to be feared that a great deal of blood is to be shed before quiet can be restored. Inflammatory placards against the Vigilance Committee were issued on Saturday evening, purporting to come from the American party, though it is said that more than one-half of that party are enrolled as members of the Committee.

docs.snippet: TWO BOATS CAPSIZED-SIX LIVES LOST. Friday afternoon four men, named HENRY CEASER, JOHN BOGERT, FREDERICK SCOTT, and WM. PAYNTON, took a sail-boat at Penny Bridge and proceeded to the lower Bay on a fishing excursion.

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN FRANCE.; The Recent Extraordinary Duel. The Queen of Holland-Death of the Duchess of Orleans--Miscellaneous Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following is the programme of court movements for the Summer: After the end of this month their Majesties will scarcely appear at Paris till the arrival of Winter, when the official residence will be at the Elysee, on account of repairs required at the Tuileries.

docs.snippet: The revolutionary movement in New-Orleans, commenced on Tuesday night, resulted yesterday afternoon in the complete triumph of the Vigilance Committee, the Mayor having resigned the Municipal authority into their hands. Our dispatches, dated at...
docs.abstract: Tried for the murder of his Brother
docs.lead_paragraph: The revolutionary movement in New-Orleans, commenced on Tuesday night, resulted yesterday afternoon in the complete triumph of the Vigilance Committee, the Mayor having resigned the Municipal authority into their hands. Our dispatches, dated at different hours throughout the day, will give an idea of the progress of affairs previous to this consummation.

headline.main: METROPOLITAN NUISANCES.; A Visit with the Committee of the Board of Health. FAT-MELTING ESTABLISHMENTS, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Three carriages stood before the City Hall at 10 o'clock Thursday morning, and shortly after that hour the Committee of the Board of Health, recently appointed to examine into and report the condition of the melting establishments and piggeries, against which complaints have been male, entered them.
